===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|ふん|どう|yomi=on}}

Uncertain. Given the [[慣用読み#Japanese|kan'yōyomi]] of ''dō'' for the {{m|ja|銅}} character, probably a Japanese coinage from {{cog|ltc|-}}-derived elements, as a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ふんどう|分|tr1=fun|pos1=a unit of weight, roughly 375 {{l|en|milligram}}s|銅|tr2=dō|t2=copper}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|ふんどう|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ふんどう}}

# a {{l|en|metal}} {{l|en|weight}}, often made of {{l|en|copper}}, used in a {{l|en|balance}} {{l|en|scale}}; traditionally had a kind of {{l|en|hourglass}} shape
# any {{l|en|gold}} or {{l|en|silver}} {{l|en|ingot}} {{l|en|cast}} in an {{l|en|hourglass}} shape; such ingots were formerly kept as emergency savings
# {{lb|ja|sort=ふんどう|obsolete|slang}} a {{m|ja|二朱銀|tr=nishugin||{{w|Edo period|Edo-period}} coin of refined silver}}
# a {{l|en|weight}} used with a {{l|en|balance}} {{l|en|scale}}
# a {{m|ja|家紋|tr=kamon||{{l|en|family}} {{l|en|crest}}}} in the shape of a {{l|en|stylize}}d ''fundō'' weight

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-r|分銅座|^ふんどう-ざ}}: the {{l|en|weights}} {{l|en|guild}}: tasked by the {{w|Edo period|Edo}} {{l|en|shogunate}} with {{l|en|standardize|standardizing}} weights and controlling their {{l|en|manufacture}} and {{l|en|distribution}}; {{l|en|abolish}}ed in February 1876
* {{ja-r|分銅桜|ふんどう-ざくら}}: a {{m|ja|家紋|tr=kamon||{{l|en|family}} {{l|en|crest}}}} in the shape of a {{m|ja|桜|tr=sakura||cherry blossom}}, with each petal depicted using a ''fundō'' shape

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|ふん|どん|yomi=irreg}}

Alteration from ''fundō''. Non-standard reading of ''don'' for {{m|ja|銅}} may indicate influence from early {{cog|cmn|-}} or {{cog|yue|-}} readings (modern ''tóng'' and ''tung²''), or perhaps more likely, influence from an early version of {{cog|ko|銅|tr=dong}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|ふんどん}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ふんどん}}

# a ''fundō'' [[weight]]
# a {{l|en|silver}} weight or {{m|ja|橙|tr=daidai||bitter orange}} tied to the end of a bit of string, used in a {{m|ja|宝引き|tr=hōbiki|pos=a kind of {{l|en|lottery}} or {{l|en|draw straws}}}}
# a {{l|en|shape}} that is {{l|en|pinch}}ed in the middle like a ''fundō'' weight

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|ぶん|どう|yomi=o}}

Alteration from ''fundō'', using the [[呉音#Japanese|{{lang|ja|sc=Latn|goon}}]] reading of ''bun'' for the {{m|ja|分}} character.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|ぶんどう}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ぶんどう}}

# a {{l|en|weight}}

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-r|分銅秤|ぶんどう-ばかり}}: a {{l|en|balance}} {{l|en|scale}}
